definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
book format, similar to in-4°, in-8° etc (a 16-kai format 16開|16开[shi2 liu4 kai1] is roughly A4)/abbr. to 開|开[kai1]
fine paper made from bamboo, used for calligraphy, painting etc/also written 毛邊|毛边[mao2 bian1]
to write the title of a book on a label
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
color printing using several overlaid images
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
